subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Pronunciation resource
msgSnippet: I believe the pronunciation key *was* for the CMU dictionary, which I think was a primary source for Moby. I had no problem reading the MobyPron file using
messageBody:
I believe the pronunciation key *was* for the CMU
dictionary, which I think was a primary source for
Moby.
I had no problem reading the MobyPron file using
WordPad; in Notepad the linefeeds were jammed
together, so you can hardly read the content.

Just in case yours was a bad download, I've
uploaded my copy here:
http://tech.groups.yahoo.com/group/read_alphabet_tech/files/mobypron.zip


I include the original file and one I saved in RTF
format; the more explicit tags might help.

--- John Cowan <cowan@...> wrote:
> Unfortunately, the Pronunciatior file unpacks
> improperly, and all the
> data is badly garbled. For example, the first word


===========
Never insult anyone by accident.
- Robert A. Heinlein
